title: VR-Based Elementary Biology Multimedia Teaching Method Design Workshop: Integrated Language Learning Approach

context.prior_knowledge: Expert-level knowledge and complex problem-solving experience, language instruction experience in primary education or foundational biology knowledge (plant/animal classification, ecosystem concepts, etc.)
context.additional_context: Course for cultivating VR multimedia learning design capabilities applicable in elementary education settings for pre-service teachers. Emphasizes collaborative learning activities conducted in BYOD environments. Focuses on project-based learning (PBL) integrating biology concepts with language learning (vocabulary expansion, sentence construction, explanatory writing)

learning_goals: Learners apply Piaget’s cognitive development theory (preoperational, concrete operational stages) to design one VR language-learning scenario for elementary students (ages 7–12), create multimedia materials using 3D modeling tools (Blender, etc.) to promote vocabulary acquisition and contextual understanding of biological terms (plant structures, animal classification, etc.), and achieve an average score of ≥4/5 on peer and instructor evaluations.

Cultivation of biology content design skills integrating audio explanations (biological concept explanations) and visual elements (3D models, animations) to enhance learners’ reading comprehension and expressive abilities.

Learners operate a 3-phase (design-implementation-analysis) VR-based formative assessment system (quizzes, observation records, discussion activities) for ≥50 learners, write a ≥10-page user manual, and achieve ≥4/5 on learner satisfaction surveys.
Application of BYOD-compatible educational VR content development techniques: multimodal integration of biology-related text, images, and audio materials.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
